publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4269♦ Elaine Murray: Wildlife Week, 6 to 14 June 2009—That the Parliament commends the Scottish Wildlife Trust (SWT) for organising Wildlife Week, 6 to 14 June 2009; notes that there are over 230 events and activities taking place throughout Scotland, including the celebration of peatlands, woodlands and marine environments in Dumfries and Galloway, and appreciates the efforts by SWT, its sister charities and non-governmental organisations in Scotland in raising public awareness of the richness of Scotland’s natural environment and the need to preserve and enhance habitats to conserve Scotland’s wildlife and ensure that future generations can also enjoy its diversity.

S3M-4269 Elaine Murray: Wildlife Week, 6 to 14 June 2009—That the Parliament commends the Scottish Wildlife Trust (SWT) for organising Wildlife Week, 6 to 14 June 2009; notes that there are over 230 events and activities taking place throughout Scotland, including the celebration of peatlands, woodlands and marine environments in Dumfries and Galloway, and appreciates the efforts by SWT, its sister charities and non-governmental organisations in Scotland in raising public awareness of the richness of Scotland’s natural environment and the need to preserve and enhance habitats to conserve Scotland’s wildlife and ensure that future generations can also enjoy its diversity. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson*, Marlyn Glen*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Bill Butler*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Pauline McNeill*, Mike Pringle*, Bill Kidd*, Mary Mulligan*, Karen Gillon*, Patrick Harvie*, Liam McArthur*, Jim Tolson*

S3M-4269 *#* Elaine Murray: Wildlife Week, 6 to 14 June 2009—That the Parliament commends the Scottish Wildlife Trust (SWT) for organising Wildlife Week, 6 to 14 June 2009; notes that there are over 230 events and activities taking place throughout Scotland, including the celebration of peatlands, woodlands and marine environments in Dumfries and Galloway, and appreciates the efforts by SWT, its sister charities and non-governmental organisations in Scotland in raising public awareness of the richness of Scotland’s natural environment and the need to preserve and enhance habitats to conserve Scotland’s wildlife and ensure that future generations can also enjoy its diversity. Supported by: Ms Wendy Alexander*, Nanette Milne*, Christine Grahame*, Robin Harper*, Jackie Baillie*, Karen Whitefield*, Patricia Ferguson*, Des McNulty*, Alison McInnes*
S3M-4269# Wildlife Week, 6 to 14 June 2009 (lodged on 28 May 2009) Sarah Boyack*, Cathy Peattie*, Gil Paterson*, Stuart McMillan*
S3M-4269# Wildlife Week, 6 to 14 June 2009 (lodged on 28 May 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Rhoda Grant*, Peter Peacock*, Marilyn Livingstone*
